title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of up to 35%
summary: Here’s a message for more recent entrants to the stock market: Corrections are inevitable in every market condition. The correction which started in September 2024 may appear to be a long one to you, but there have been much longer phases of correction in the past. Yes, it is difficult to live through corrections. But remember: Real wealth is made when you ignore the noise and stay with good businesses. They will grow and become large-cap companies.

title: Asian stocks dip on Korea tariffs, Yen holds gains
summary: Asian equities declined as renewed tariff concerns emerged following President Trump's threat of levies on South Korean goods. The yen held its gains, while the Kospi Index fell and the South Korean won weakened. Investors await megacap technology earnings to gauge the sustainability of the AI-driven rally.

title: Markets fall 4% in January over foreign fund outflows
summary: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty have seen a significant decline of over 4% this month, driven by foreign fund outflows, a weakening rupee, and geopolitical risks. Market participants are hoping for a pre-budget recovery, a trend observed historically. Elevated crude oil prices and rising global bond yields are further contributing to investor caution.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian markets are set to resume trading after a Republic Day holiday. On Friday, both Nifty and Sensex closed lower, with technical analysts indicating a weak short-to-medium term sentiment. Volatility is expected to remain elevated heading into the Budget week, with key support and resistance levels identified.

title: Stocks in news: Asian Paints, Vodafone Idea, Axis Bank, BPCL, MCX, PVR Inox, Marico, Emkay Global
summary: Domestic markets saw a decline on Friday, with the Nifty and BSE Sensex slipping significantly due to broad-based selling. Several companies like Asian Paints, Vodafone Idea, and Axis Bank are in focus today due to their Q3 earnings reports and other corporate developments. Major players reported mixed financial results, impacting market sentiment.

title: Eternal shares in stress on Q-comm cash burn quest
summary: Online delivery firm Eternal's stock dipped nearly 9% despite strong December quarter profits, driven by investor concerns over escalating competition. Slower store expansion boosted profitability, but increased spending to accelerate quick commerce growth may impact future earnings. Analysts maintain 'buy' ratings but have trimmed target prices.

title: Emerging Asia lures capital  as geopolitics rattle risk mood
summary: Emerging Asian markets are attracting new investment as a safe haven amid ongoing geopolitical uncertainties. While tariff threats against Europe have temporarily eased market jitters, persistent tensions in the Middle East and Latin America are driving investors towards regions offering superior risk-adjusted returns and stronger economic fundamentals.

title: Waaree enters grid infrastructure with ₹1,225 crore buy of 55% stake in Gujarat-based Associated Power Structures
summary: Waaree Renewable Technologies will acquire a 55% stake in Gujarat-based Associated Power Structures Ltd for ₹1,225 crore, marking the Waaree Group’s entry into grid and transmission infrastructure. The deal involves a mix of primary and secondary share purchases and will make APSL a subsidiary of Waaree Renewable, valuing the company at ₹2,800 crore.

title: Stock Radar: Infosys stock gives a breakout above 6-month long consolidation zone; time to buy for medium-term?
summary: Infosys shares are showing strength, trading above a key resistance level. Experts suggest this indicates a likely upward movement. Traders can consider buying the stock for potential gains towards Rs 1,900 in the coming months. The IT major's recent performance and future outlook, including AI implementation, are positive factors.

title: Gold, Silver Rate Today LIVE: COMEX silver price cracks 7%, gold price falls over 1%, retreats from record highs
summary: Gold, Silver Rate Today LIVE: Gold prices have surged nearly 17% so far this year, supported by so-called debasement trade as investor flight from sovereign bonds and currencies, a weak US dollar, and geopolitical risks.

title: No more fireworks for markets—Budget Day 'big bang' loses its spark amid year-round reforms
summary: Markets now anticipate policy months in advance, as reforms, tax tweaks and sector-specific measures roll out steadily throughout the year, leaving Budget Day itself largely predictable and muted.

title: Adani Power’s India grid plan gains urgency amid Bangladesh tariff row
summary: While Adani's coal-fired plant in Jharkhand's Godda is currently linked only to the Bangladesh grid, the company has received an approval to connect to the Indian grid, too. It had indicated it would be connected to India’s power infrastructure by December 2025, but that hasn’t been completed yet.

title: MCX shares in focus as Q3 PAT skyrockets 151% YoY
summary: MCX reported a sharp jump in Q3FY26 earnings, driven by strong growth in trading volumes and operating leverage. Revenue and profit rose sharply year on year and sequentially, supported by higher derivatives activity, improved margins and new product launches in the bullion segment.

title: Wipro shares in focus as stock turns ex-date for Rs 6 interim dividend
summary: Wipro shares are set to trade ex-dividend on January 27 following the announcement of an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share. The payout reflects the company’s continued dividend track record, with payments scheduled by mid-February, while the stock remains in focus amid recent price weakness.

title: Kotak Mahindra Bank shares in focus after Q3 PAT rises 4% YoY. What should investors do?
summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank reported steady Q3FY26 performance, with moderate profit growth, improving asset quality and stable margins. Net interest income rose sequentially and year on year, while lower NPAs and higher provision coverage supported fundamentals. A brokerage upgrade reflects confidence in operational stability and valuation prospects.

title: Ashok Leyland and 3 other stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout

Such price levels reflect sustained buying interest and improving trend strength, though a swing high differs from a confirmed long-term breakout.

Marico shares in focus after acquiring PVR Inox's popcorn brand for Rs 227 crore

title: Apex Frozen Foods, Gokaldas Exports and other textile, shrimp stocks rally up to 12% as India-EU trade talks conclude
summary: Shares of Indian textile and shrimp companies surged following the conclusion of a free trade agreement with the European Union. This pact, a result of 18 years of negotiations, is expected to boost bilateral trade. Additionally, renewed optimism for an India-US trade deal emerged after US President Donald Trump's positive remarks. These developments signal potential growth for export-focused sectors.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Goldman Sachs hikes target price on UltraTech Cements; Elara Capital upgrades Kotak Bank
summary: Brokerage firms remain positive on select frontline stocks, with Goldman Sachs raising its target price on UltraTech Cements and Elara Capital maintaining a Buy on BPCL while upgrading Kotak Mahindra Bank, citing resilient earnings and improving fundamentals.

title: Selling stocks to buy gold and silver ETFs? Why turning a hedge into a bet can backfire
summary: Retail investors bruised by small-cap losses are increasingly considering selling equities to chase soaring gold and silver ETFs. With precious metals sharply outperforming stocks, the temptation is strong. However, wealth managers warn that reallocating based on recent returns reflects recency bias and risks undermining disciplined asset allocation by turning portfolio hedges into concentrated bets near a potential cycle peak.

title: Silver soars 6%, gold up over 1% to scale new peak and this may just be the start. Check where the bullion is headed now
summary: Gold and silver hit fresh lifetime highs on the MCX on Tuesday amid strong safe-haven demand and ongoing geopolitical tensions. Gold February futures traded above Rs 1.58 lakh after breaching $5,100 globally, while silver March futures rallied nearly 6%. International prices also stayed firm, supported by a softer dollar and robust investor demand. Analysts see continued volatility, with bullion expected to remain firm and buying on dips advised.

title: Axis Bank shares surge over 4% as Q3 PAT rises 3% YoY. Should you buy now?
summary: Axis Bank shares saw a significant jump on Tuesday. The bank reported a 3% year-on-year rise in its standalone net profit for the December quarter. Net interest income also showed growth. Brokerages like Citi and Bernstein have reacted positively to the results, maintaining their ratings and target prices. The bank's asset quality remains stable, with strong provision coverage ratios.

summary: UltraTech Cement reported a strong Q3FY26 with a 32% YoY profit jump to Rs 1,792 crore and a 22.5% rise in net sales. Brokerage firms like Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Elara Capital have reiterated positive ratings, raising target prices due to robust volume growth, pricing power, and cost efficiencies.

summary: Hyundai Motor India shares are under scrutiny following US President Trump's threat to hike tariffs on South Korean autos to 25%. This move stems from alleged delays in South Korea's legislative approval of a trade deal. Despite a sequential sales dip in December 2025, Hyundai's exports saw significant year-on-year growth.

summary: Indian stock markets opened lower on Tuesday. Global cues, including US tariffs and upcoming Federal Reserve decisions, influenced trading. Sensex and Nifty saw declines. Kotak Mahindra Bank and Axis Bank reported their Q3FY26 earnings. Foreign institutional investors continued selling, impacting the rupee. Global markets showed mixed trends. Oil prices remained flat.

summary: Gold price today: Rates hit record high on strong safe-haven demand. MCX gold February futures surged by nearly  ₹4,000, or more than 2.4%, to  ₹1,59,820 per 10 grams, while MCX silver March futures surged by more than  ₹25,000, or 7.5%, to a record high of  ₹3,59,800 per kg.

title: Adani Green Energy shares zoom 6% as investors buy the dip. Here’s what happened
summary: Adani Green Energy shares rebounded 6% as investors bought the dip after a sharp sell-off triggered by regulatory concerns and weak Q3 results. Sentiment improved following company clarification and updates on capacity additions.

title: Hindustan Zinc shares jump 4% as silver prices soar 45% in 2026. Check target, upside
summary: Hindustan Zinc shares surged to a fresh 52-week high of Rs 731, driven by a sharp rally in silver prices which crossed $100 per troy ounce. summary: Vodafone Idea's share price traded in a tight range ahead of Q3 results today, hitting a low and a high of  ₹9.71 and  ₹10, respectively. However, 2026 has started on a weak footing for the telecom stock as it has lost almost 15% on a month-to-date (MTD) basis.

title: Adani Power, Adani Green to Adani Enterprises: Why are Adani Group stocks surging today? Explained
summary: Adani Group stocks rallied on January 27 after Adani Enterprises clarified it is not involved in ongoing legal proceedings referenced in media reports. This statement alleviated investor concerns following last week's sell-off.

title: Foundation PE looks to ramp up India bets as secondary market gains momentum
summary: After deploying about 60% of its $120 million maiden fund in India, the pan-Asian secondaries firm says rising liquidity needs among PE and VC funds are creating fresh opportunities.

title: BPCL shares rise 3% as Q3 net profit jumps 89%. Buy, sell or hold?
summary: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited shares surged following a significant 98% rise in December quarter net profit. The company announced a Rs 10 per share interim dividend for FY26. Improved refining margins and a stronger balance sheet contributed to the positive outlook. Analysts maintain a buy rating with a potential upside.

title: Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports, Adani Green shares rebound up to 6%. What’s triggering the uptick?
summary: Adani group shares rebounded up to 5% after a significant sell-off, following news of Adani executives' willingness to negotiate with the US SEC regarding summons. Lawyers are discussing an agreement to resolve service of process, with the SEC seeking court permission for direct email delivery after India rejected official requests.

title: IndusInd Bank share price target: Should you buy, hold or sell after earnings miss? Here’s what brokerages recommend
summary: IndusInd Bank reported a sharp year on year profit decline in Q3FY26, broadly in line with estimates. Brokerages offered mixed views, with ratings ranging from Outperform to Reduce, citing elevated stress, muted growth and a gradual recovery outlook.

title: Budget 2026: Anticipating a shift from attracting foreign investors to retaining them
summary: India's foreign investment landscape has seen net outflows recently, despite strong market returns. To counter this, Budget 2026 is urged to offer competitive tax rates on long-term investments for both FPIs and FDIs. Lowering taxes on capital gains and dividends, along with making debt markets more attractive, could stabilize inflows and boost reserves.

title: Jefferies cuts Paytm price target to Rs 1,450 on incentive structure changes
summary: Jefferies has cut its price target on Paytm to Rs 1,450 after removing PIDF incentives from estimates, trimming EBITDA forecasts for FY27 and FY28. Despite the downgrade, the brokerage maintained its Buy rating, citing strong core business traction.

title: Mahindra, Tata, Hyundai, other auto stocks fall up to 5%. Here’s why
summary: Auto stocks fell sharply as investors reacted to reports that the India EU free trade agreement could significantly lower import tariffs on European cars. Concerns over increased competition weighed on shares of Mahindra, Tata Motors, Hyundai and Maruti Suzuki.

summary: As gold prices extend gains, Ray Dalio warns of a historic shift in monetary systems. He cites geopolitical tensions and central banks increasing gold reserves as indicators of moving away from a dollar-centric framework toward a more diversified reserve approach.

title: Small-cap EV stock Mercury Ev-Tech jumps over 14% despite sideways markets
summary: Small-cap EV stock Mercury Ev-Tech rose over 14% amid weak market sentiment, reaching an intraday high of  ₹40.99. The surge is attributed to the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, which may exempt battery electric vehicles from import duties for five years, benefiting local investments.

summary: As rivals snap up digital-first personal care brands, ITC is moving cautiously—focusing on trust-led categories and long-term value over rapid acquisitions, said Sameer Satpathy, head, personal care business.

title: Managing investments in 2026 amid volatile markets and geopolitical uncertainty
summary: From crypto SIPs and precious metals to IPO mania, 2025 saw investors chase returns like never before. As markets remind them of risk, 2026 calls for discipline over FOMO.
